revised_title: Manometric Observations in the Electric Arc: Pressure and Arc Behavior
tldr: The author conducted manometric observations in the electric arc to study the pressure inside the gaseous envelope. They discovered that the interior of the arc always showed a fixed permanent pressure, about a millimeter of water above the surrounding atmosphere. The author discusses various possible causes of this pressure, such as motion of gas particles, transit of material from pole to pole, or a succession of disruptive discharges.
